data.title: Shadow length
data.solution:
import sys
import math

angle = int(input()) # read angle
angle = (angle/180)*math.pi # convert degrees to radian

N = int(input()) # read number of buildings

biggest = 0

for i in range(N):
    height = int(input()) # read height of the Nth building
    height = height*100 # convert meters to centimeters

    size = height/math.tan(angle) # calculate the size of the shadow
    size = abs(size) # the length of a shadow cannot be negative, even if "angle > 90", it's just oriented in the opposite way
    size = round(size) # round it to output an integer as asked

    if size > biggest:
        biggest = size

print(biggest)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The aim is to find the size of the biggest shadow made by a serie of buildings, given their height and the angle between the sun and the horizon.
To tackle this one, you will need a bit of trigonometry (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trigonometry).
We of course assume that it's a sunny day, without any cloud in the sky :)
Input
Line 1: An integer angle : the angle between the sun and the horizon, in degrees
Line 2: An integer N : the number of buildings in the city
N next lines An integer height : the height of the Nth building, in meters
Output
size : the size of the biggest shadow made by the tallest building of the city, in centimeters, rounded to the nearest integer
Constraints
0 < angle < 180
0 < N < 10
0 < height < 1000
Example
Input
60
1
8
Output
462
